sub_title: Sustainability Lead @ Manzeera | MSc³ | Business Consulting | DOMO
summary:
As a sustainability consultant at Manzeera Solutions and co-founder of wegozero's zero-waste map, I'm empowering businesses and consumers to improve their sustainable practices, while am actively applying my interdisciplinary knowledge in sustainability marketing, law and sustainability governance.

Graduating from a Russell Group university with honours in International Relations, while contributing with various extracurricular roles in different societies, I have completed my master degrees at the world's no.1 university for Communication Science* and the oldest law school of the Netherlands (ranking top 10 in Europe and to 50 worldwide**) ー alongside working at wegozero. With my unique cross-sector qualification, I am enthusiastic about continuing my professional career, applying my knowledge beyond the walls of leading research-institutions. Being able to analyse issues from a legal, a social-political, and a persuasive-marketing perspective has proven to be a powerful tool of mine: it enables me to apply a critical perspective from different viewpoints in problem-solving. 
Besides research, analytics, sustainability, law and marketing, I have been into finance and many extracurricular roles of responsibility, as a president, a non-law representative, a student ambassador, a master's committee member, and others. 

I am looking forward to support Your sustainability journey towards a net zero.

* QS ranking University of Amsterdam, 2018 –
** QS ranking Leiden Law School, 2018 –

projects.title: EU Climate-KIC: Sustainable Startup Development and Management
projects.description:
As wegozero has been selected as one of the 15 (first round), then 10 (second round) participants in the Climate-KIC Project for start-ups, I have been attending a series of workshops on
– market- and consumer analysis,
– business management,
– UPS,
– business-storytelling,
– enterprise sales,
– fundraising & investment,
– and climate impact measurement & forecast.
At the end of the project, we have been able to present our business plan to investors, alongside receiving two grants for our start-up's growth.

projects.title: Marketing Campaign Plan Quorn
projects.description:
Quorn has been struggling to compete with other vegetarian/vegan supplements in the Dutch market. This project has been investigating this issue and proposing a campaign plan to overcome this struggle.
The project includes:
– problem analysis
– consumer analysis
– market- & competition analysis
– SWOT analysis
– advertising objectives
– creative strategy
– media plan
– measuring campaign outcomes

projects.title: Focus Week: Armed Conflict, Gender and Women Rights in Contemporary Eastern Europe
projects.description: Organising and hosting the annual Focus Week of the Graduate School of Social Sciences at the University of Amsterdam. This year's focus was on Eastern Europe: the armed conflict at the Russian-Ukrainian border, Turkey's withrawal from the Istanbul convention and women rights in Poland, following the proposal of abortion ban. Conflicts are closer to us than ever before. Conflict is happening in Europe. This needs our attention and analysis. We have invited panelists from all over the World, from the US Home Office and fellow universities as well.

projects.title: Create a Course Challenge: Communication in Times of Crisis
projects.description:
Create a Course Challenge Finalist
I have created a course about 'Communication in Times of Crisis' to be taught at the University of Amsterdam. The course's goal was to enable students to overcome one-sides information gathering, to endorse critical thinking and analytical skills. This course has been selected for the public vote round from where it has went through to the Finals.

profile_positions.description:
As a Project Leader, I have been involved in 
– business auditing and consulting,
– operation efficiency improvement,
– environmental-impact auditing and reporting (energy, oil & gas, travel, water, waste, fleet, logistics),
– scope 3 emission carbon reporting 
– ESG reporting to client's management and stakeholders, 
– aligning clients' frameworks with (forecasted) regulations,
– CO₂ carbon-footprint accounting,
– net-zero strategy advising,
– and sustainability-data tracking & monitoring (energy, oil & gas, travel, water, waste, fleet, logistics, CO₂)
with a 360-degree view on sustainability, taking a platform-process-people approach. 
'Sustainability is not a long IT project, it is about the people involved and the stakeholders to collaborate'. A single central platform covering all information enables seamless discussion in decision-making, and makes net-zero a reality.
I have not only developed my management skillset, but have also become a team-leader. Pitching to prospective clients, briefing existing clients on the progress, supporting my team in their questions and challenges.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Lead

profile_positions.description:
I was delighted to accept the invitation to support TwynstraGudde in its project on 'How can we create widespread support among citizens and local politics for the construction of wind- and solar-fields in the municipality of Gorinchem?' This project aims to bring the municipality in line with national government goals set for 2030 and the SDGs.
This project has involved
– market research & analysis of the RES Alblasserwaard (municipality of Gorinchem and Molenlanden),
– on-site audit of Alblasserwaard's community,
– communication strategy building,
– and pitching the final product to the municipality.

As a result of the strategy plan's success, we have been working on it's implementation beyond the SDG challenge by 
– setting up the invitation of stakeholders,
– working together with WeEnergy to add the map of Gorinchem to the game-platform,
– and conducting the WeEnergy game with a pre- and post-experience questionnaire, to analyse stakeholders' perceptions.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Consultant

profile_positions.description:
We have built a zero waste map for European cities, to connect conscious consumers with businesses who offer sustainable, zero waste products or services. Reducing our emissions as individuals, and as businesses, is the struggle of today, and the requirement of governments from tomorrow.
We support local, small businesses in reaching a new consumer-segment, through a new topic: zero waste!
Through our early phase, we have become supported by the EU's Climate KIC. It has been an honour to be acknowledged by the EU and to be able work on the growth of wegozero's map, while participating in valuable workshops on scaling up sustainable businesses. 
Be part of our inspiring, rapidly expanding network!

wegozero maps B.V.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & CFO

profile_positions.description:
At this thriving sustainability consultancy, I have been involved in 
– (zero) waste auditing (e.g. GitHub, Microsoft),
– webshop product marketing for our clients (e.g., littleplantpantry.com),
– SEO content-creating, 
– copywriting,
– PR (social media),
– pitching,
– market- & consumer (persona) analysis, financial- & market projections, etc. as part of conducting a Business Plan for wegozero.

I have been creating product-descriptions, optimising persuasive content for sales, as well as creating product-photography. In addition, I have been working on website development and design for sales.
I have also been actively contributing with market research (on customer sustainability-trends and needs, and persuasive communication to increase participation in zero waste practices), and auditing our clients' waste, consulting them on how to reduce it.
Also, due to my background I have been overlooking the finances & bookkeeping of the company.

This position has enabled me to shift towards an area more related to my studies in persuasive communication, while receiving numerous valuable training hours for SEO, marketing, media and other valuable skills. Alongside, I have still been able to apply my existing analytical- and financial skills. In addition, participating in the 180degrees consulting has broadened my consulting  insights and creative problem-solvings skills.

wegozero B.V.

profile_positions.description:
The complex role of ambassadors include: 
– organising and managing open days and workshops (both on-campus and virtually), 
– helping prospective students through a chat platform, 
– submitting blog posts to the UvA website with useful information about the application/university life/education system/living in Amsterdam/etc., 
– and representing the university wherever needed.
profile_positions.title: Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
Quantitative content analysis research to examine and compare how the issue of raising the retirement age is framed in European news media. The cross-country comparison project analyses the framing in newspaper articles about raising the retirement age across four European countries, namely the Netherlands, Denmark, Spain, and the UK.
In this research project I have been coding British newspaper articles (2011-2020) on variables that are mainly focused on framing. This has highly contributed my research- and analytical skills in a professional setting, beyond my studies.
Upon being selected for working on this competitive research, I have received a professional content analysis coder-training.
Most importantly, this position has developed my skill in picking up the thought-process and logic of my fellow coders, in order to maximise the inter-coder reliability, that focuses on our codings' similarity score. I addition, I have been exercising my attention to detail (noticing duplicates, keywords, etc. among 500 documents) precision and speedy effectiveness.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I have been responsible for the invoice booking and accounting of 2 Grundfos sub-regions as part of the Account Payables (accounting) and Vendor Communication Specialist team in the Purchase to Pay department of Grundfos Shared Services. 
Collaborating in a team, I was able to support other tasks besides my own: I have been involved in 
– vendor communication, 
– other regions' invoice processing, 
– month-end closing and reporting.
In addition, I was able to participate in Grundfos' charities and programmes of 'giving back to the community', such as the Water2Life programme.

This position has allowed me to take individual responsibility while being a true part of a team, where I could seek support while also helping others' with their workload. It has been particularly rewarding to become the 'Team of the Month' in August 2019, as a result of our well-structured teamwork.

Being ahead with my duties, I was also able to support the work around the reception.

company.name: De Bink, méér dan alleen drukwerk

volunteer_experiences.description:
With my team I have been conducting an audit for Drukkerij de Bink in order to assess its sustainability potentials and formulate recommendations to further improve its circularity.
Find our audit report here: https://www.canva.com/design/DAFYAhp8ljE/IfhwxAG3cgKy-V7cdD7wIA/edit?utm_content=DAFYAhp8ljE&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=sharebutton

Tackling drug-waste to protect the environment. Synthetic drug waste disposal, help?!
In 2021, yet another drug discharge was found. This time in a Brabant forest. A meter-deep pit with drug waste that causes major environmental problems (Keukenkamp, 2021). This is a nightmare for nature and these substances can be very dangerous for humans (Drinkwater Platform, 2021). In the first half of 2021, the number of drug dumping increased by 64%, making it a major problem (Police, 2021). All this data is problematic, which is why innovative ideas are important.

Why is this challenge important?
The drug barn of Europe. In the world of drugs, for example, one can look at Brabant. In Bram Endedijk's book of the same name, there is even a chapter called 'Breaking bad in Brabant', but this problem does not only occur in Brabant. Tens of billions are lost in the drug industry, many people are killed, officials are bribed and kilograms of drug waste are discharged. This drug waste is toxic to humans and animals and can end up in the ground water due to dumping (Roks et al., 2021). A study by Kruize and Gruter (2020) shows that the police in the Netherlands discovered 191 dump locations in 2019. This given, there is always a dark number that plays with it. The police do not always find all the dumps and so in reality there will be more than 191 dumpings.

Preventive or repressive
A problem can have both a preventive and a repressive solution.
Preventive: A prevention solution focuses on preventing a problem. The intervention therefore takes place before the 'offence' occurs.
Repressive: Repressive action revolves around suppressing certain behavior. Following certain rules or handing out fines can have a deterrent effect. This is about punishing 'wrong' behaviour.
I have been boosting the webshop of this zero waste grocery store, with marketing copywriting and visual content creating.
